classes.title: ASIAN RELIG TRADS
classes.description: An introduction to the basic texts, institutions, and   practices of the religious traditions of South Asia and East   Asia.

classes.title: EAST ASIAN PRE-MOD
classes.description: An introduction to the social structures, institutions, systems of thought and belief, and the arts and entertainments of China and Japan during the pre-modern period.

classes.title: INTRO TO BUDDHISM
classes.description: The historical and cross-cultural exploration of Buddhism through the examination of basic texts, institutions, and practices of diverse Buddhist traditions.

classes.title: INDEP RESEARCH ASST
classes.description: Research details are decided by the supervising Professor in   the Department of East Asian Languages and Cultural Studies.

classes.title: INTRO TO DAOISM
classes.description: A study of the classical sources of Daoism, followed by a   consideration o f the varieties of religious practice which   developed from those sources.

classes.title: BUDDHIST VISUAL CUL
classes.description: This course explores the rich world of Buddhist visual culture, ranging fro m meditation to addressing the use of painted images in public performances . It focuses on sacred images, their rituals, and theories of representatio n behind their creation and use.

classes.title: INDEPENDENT STUDY
classes.description: Independent Study under the supervision of a faculty member.
